Question: How to save the text file in a path given by JFileChooser?: :I need to save a text File which is already created in a particular path given by JFileChooser. What I do basically to save is:public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {   JFileChooser chooser = new JFileChooser();   int status = chooser.showSaveDialog(null);   if (status == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {      System.out.print(chooser.getCurrentDirectory());      // Don't know how to do it   }How to save the text file in a path given by JFileChooser?
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
   JFileChooser chooser = new JFileChooser();
   int status = chooser.showSaveDialog(null);
   if (status == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
      File selectedFile = chooser.getSelectedFile();
      try {
         PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(selectedFile);
         writer.write("Your text here");
         writer.close();
      } catch (IOException ex) {
         ex.printStackTrace();
      }
   }
}
<<<explanation>>>: 
To save the text file in a path given by JFileChooser, you can use the PrintWriter.write API. Finally, close the PrintWriter using the writer.close method. If an IOException occurs during this process, it is handled by catching the IOException and printing the stack trace.
